docs.title: Welcome to Lernez!
docs.text: A free and open-source wiki for learning Ido!

docs.title: What is Ido?
docs.text:
Ido is a constructed language designed with the goal of being a universal second language (also known as an international auxiliary language) for people of different linguistic backgrounds.

To function as an effective international auxiliary language, Ido was specifically designed to be grammatically, orthographically, and lexicographically regular (and, above all, easy to learn and use).

docs.title: Relative, interrogative, and demonstrative
docs.text: What (Relative and interrogative) That (Demonstrative) Person/individual -u qua/quiwho (i)ta/(i)tithat (one)/those (ones) Thing -o quowhat (i)tothat (thing) Plural -i Adjective -a Motive pro Possession di Place -loke, -u ubewhere ibethere Time -tempe kandewhen lorethen Way/Manner -e, -maniere qualehow talethat way Quality -a, -speca qualawhat kind of talasuch (of that kind), such like Quantity -e? quantehow much tantethat much Quantity – noun -o quantoquantity, amount tantothat much Quantity – adjective -a quantahow much, how many tantathat much

docs.title: Indefinite quantities
docs.text: Some (Indeterminate) Any (Most indeterminate) Other Person ulu/ulisomeone irgu/irgianyone altru/altrisomeone else Thing ulosomething irgoanything altrosomething else Place ulubesomewhere irgubeanywhere altrubeelsewhere Time ulatempesometime irgatempeanytime altratempeat another time Way ulamanieresomehow irgamanierein any way altramanierein another way Quality ulaspecasome kind of irgaspecaany kind of altraspecaanother kind of Quantity kelkesome irga quantohowever much altra quantoanother quantity

docs.title: Definite quantities
docs.text: No / none (Negative) Every (Collective) Person nuluno one omnu/omnieveryone Thing nulonothing omnoeverything Place nulubenowhere omnubeeverywhere Time nulatempenever semprealways Way nulamanierein no way omnamanierein every way Quality nulaspecano kind of omnaspecaall kinds of Quantity nulonone omnoall

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• http://io.ido.li/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/Correlatives.pdf
  • https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Category:Ido_correlatives
  • https://nekredebla.wordpress.com/

  1. The initial syllable can omitted: ta, to, ti, ta, pro to, di to. ↩

  2. Because of the ease of pronunciation, the first word ending can be omitted: ultempe, nultempe, ulspeca, nulspeca, ulmaniere, nulmaniere. ↩

  3. omnatempe is technically correct and in turn usable, but sempre is the official word. ↩

docs.title: Greetings
docs.text:
• Hello
    • saluto – greeting
    • saluti – greetings
    • hola – hello, hi
  • Welcome – bonvenez
  • Good day – bona jorno
    • lit. good day

docs.title: Farewells
docs.text:
• Goodbye
    • adio
    • til rivido
      • lit. "until the reseeing"
      • fig. "until we see each other again"
    • til la rivido – longer form of "til rivido"
    • til – short for "til rivido!"
    • chao
      • neologism, often informal
      • only in the sense of "goodbye"
    • chau – alternative form of "chao"

docs.title: Thanks and pleadings
docs.text:
• I pray, I beg; If you please – me pregas
  • Thank you
    • danko
    • me dankas – lit. I am thankful; I thank

docs.title: Declarations
docs.text:
• I love you
    • me amas vu (formal)
    • me amoras tu (informal; intimate)
      • lit. I love you passionately
  • I have a question – me havas questiono

docs.title: Questions
docs.text:
• What is that? – Quo esas ito?
    • lit. What (thing) is that (thing)?
  • How are you? – Quale vu standas?
    • lit. How is your state/condition/health?
  • What is your name? – Quale vu nomesas?
    • lit. How are you named/called?
  • How old are you? – Quante vu evas?
    • lit. How many (years) are you aged?
    • respond with: Me evas {age} yari – I am aged {age} years / I am {age} years old
      • Me evas dek e sis yari. ― I am sixteen years old.

docs.title: Prefixes / Prefixi
docs.text: This is a non-exhaustive list of Ido prefixes.

docs.title: ad-
docs.text:
Semantics: The prefix ad means the same as the preposition ad (a).

Morphology: In compounding, the longer form ad is used, not a.

Antonym: de-

  1. to (indicating that to which there is movement, tendency or position, with or without arrival)

Examples:

  • adhike (ad- 'to' + hike 'here') – hither, to here, to this place
  • adporter (ad- 'to' + porter 'carry, bring') – bring, carry (to a person or place)
  • adirar (ad- 'to' + irar 'go (be on one's way)') – go to, go towards, approach

docs.title: an- (TODO EX)
docs.text:
Semantics: The prefix an has the same meaning as the preposition an.

  1. at
  2. on (indicates contiguity, juxtaposition)

Examples:

docs.title: ante-
docs.text:
Semantics: The prefix ante means the same as the preposition ante.

Antonym: pos-

  1. before (of time)
  2. earlier than

Examples:

  • antediluvia (ante- 'before' + diluvia 'flood') – antediluvian
  • antemortar (ante- 'before' + mortar 'die') – predecease
  • anteprelasta (ante- 'before' + pre- 'pre-' + last- 'last' + '-a' adjectival ending) – antepenultimate

docs.title: anti-
docs.text:
Semantics: In scientific and technical terminology anti- means "against".

Synonym: kontre-

  1. anti-
  2. contra-
  3. counter-

Examples:

  • antimilitala (anti- 'anti-' + militala 'military, martial, warlike') – anti-war
  • antipatriota (anti -'anti-' + patriota 'patriotic') – unpatriotic
  • antisepta (anti 'anti' + septa 'septic') – antiseptic

Usage notes: For use mainly in scientific terms.

docs.title: apud-
docs.text:
Semantics: The prefix apud to has the same meaning as the preposition apud.

Synonyms: che, an

  1. next to
  2. beside
  3. by
  4. immediate vicinity

docs.title: arki-
docs.text:
Semantics: This prefix means superior or distinguished degree.

  1. prefix used especially in titles:
    • of eminent degree
    • chief
  2. arch-, archi-

Examples:

  • arkiduko (arki 'arch-' + duko 'duke') – archduke
  • arkiepiskopo (arki 'arch-' + episkopo 'bishop') – archbishop
  • arkianjelo (arki 'arch-' + anjelo 'angel') – archangel
